meanings.definition: A shoe or sandal with a thick wooden sole.
meanings.sent1: I wore my favorite clog to the picnic.
meanings.sent2: The clog was comfortable to walk in.
meanings.sent3: The clog danced off my foot and into the mud!
meanings.sent4: Her clog echoed loudly on the wooden floor.
meanings.sent5: The clog's wooden sole made a distinct sound with each step.

meanings.sent1: Leaves clog the gutter every fall.
meanings.sent2: Please don't clog the sink with food scraps.
meanings.sent3: The traffic jam was caused by cars trying to clog the road.
meanings.sent4: His mind seemed to clog with worry.
meanings.sent5: The fallen tree clogged the path, making it impassable.

meanings.sent1: The clog in the drain needed to be cleared.
meanings.sent2: A clog in the pipe caused the water to back up.
meanings.sent3: The clog of leaves in the gutter created a mini waterfall.
meanings.sent4: The clog in communication led to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent5: The clog in the system caused delays in production.
